title: Distributed Systems Concepts
content: Distributed systems involve multiple autonomous computers that communicate through a network. Key concepts include consensus algorithms, fault tolerance, and eventual consistency.

title: Microservices Architecture
content: Microservices break down applications into loosely coupled, independently deployable services. Each service owns its data and communicates via APIs. Benefits include scalability and independent deployment cycles.

title: Consensus Algorithms in Blockchain
content: Consensus mechanisms like Proof of Work and Proof of Stake ensure network agreement on transaction validity. Byzantine Fault Tolerant algorithms are critical for security in distributed ledgers.

title: Fault Tolerance and Resilience
content: Building resilient systems requires handling failures gracefully. Circuit breakers, retry logic, and health checks prevent cascading failures. Monitoring and observability are essential for detecting issues early.

title: Network Protocols and APIs
content: REST APIs use HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) for resource manipulation. gRPC provides faster, binary communication. GraphQL allows flexible data querying with a declarative syntax.

title: Data Consistency and Replication
content: Eventual consistency trades immediate consistency for availability and partition tolerance (CAP theorem). Master-slave replication, CRDT, and versioning strategies maintain data integrity across replicas.
